attributes.action: Stop the Audit Commission in conjuction with credit reference agencies or otherwise from creating 'hit' lists for investigation when there is no prima facie evidence that the people on these hit lists have done anything wrong or are receiving a benefit that they are not lawfully entitled to on the grounds that some people on these lists will turn out after investigation to have been doing something wrong.  This undermines the presumption of innocence and is unfair.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
No innocent person should be listed as a criminal suspect on what are basically statisitcal grounds. This unfair practice flies in the face of natural justice. Using personal information supplied in order to register one's right to vote in a democracy in this unfair manner is especially outrageous.

A full and independent investigation with the aim of clear and statutory limitations on NFI data mining and an explanation of how the NFI initially falsely believed this is 'unambiguous matching'  is urgently required.  

While no one should defraud the taxpayer, innocent and entitled people should not be stigmatised and bullied as they are in these guesswork based investigations.
